properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 3 at 2:29PM EST until January 3 at 5:30PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
* At 225 PM EST, Doppler radar indicates the earlier heavy rainfall
has ended across central Greenville County; however, an area of 1-3
inches of rainfall occurred between approximately 10:30am and noon,
causing flooding of low-lying areas and several roadways.

* Several reports of flooded roads have been received by local media
and law enforcement.  These roads include: Spartanburg St, Hilly St,
the Swamp Rabbit Trail at River St, Lakehurst St, Byrdland Dr, and
West Blue Ridge Dr. Roadway flooding of less than 12" depth may
continue for a few more hours as runoff continues to work through
area streams and poorly draining areas.  It is important to
continue to heed all barricades and seek an alternative route.

* Area streams continue to rise, though cresting should be imminent
for most streams.  Nevertheless, additional flooding adjacent to
streams is likely over the next few hours as it takes a while for
excessive runoff to work through the soils and into adjacent
streams.  Therefore, avoid streams and adjacent areas through the
evening hours.

* The following streamgauges have exceeded Minor Flood Stage:
Reedy River at Hudson St and Reedy River at Westfield St.

Current Stage: 9.40 feet and rising slowly.
Forecast: Reedy Creek will rise to between 10 and 11 feet before
cresting later this afternoon.
Action Stage: 8.0 feet.
Minor Flood Stage: 9.0 feet.
Impacts: At 10.0 feet, low-lying areas along the Reedy River and
Swamp Rabbit Trail between E Bramlett Rd and Newtown Park to River
St to Reedy River Falls Park and Cleveland Park will be flooding.
Expect closures to the Swamp Rabbit Trail and Cleveland Park.

* The following streamgauge has exceeded Action/Advisory Stage:
Brushy Creek near Boiling Springs Rd in Taylors.

Current Stage: 9.00 feet and rising steadily.
Forecast: Brushy Creek will continue to rise to between 10.0 feet
and 10.5 feet before cresting later this afternoon.
Action Stage: 8.5 feet.
Minor Flood Stage: 10.0 feet.
Impacts: At 10.0 feet, low-lying areas along Brushy Creek from
Old Spartanburg Hwy to Scottswood Rd, Ellesmere Dr, Devenger Rd,
Thornblade Blvd, and Dry Pocket Rd are flooding, including areas
of the Thornblade Golf Club.

* Some locations that will continue to experience flooding include...
Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Greer,
Mauldin, Taylors, Berea, Five Forks, Welcome and Travelers Rest.

* Additional heavy rainfall is possible this afternoon and evening.
Given the very wet antecedent conditions, any additional heavy
rainfall may prompt new rounds of flooding.  Please stay weather
aware.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Heavy rainfall is causing significant ponding of water in urban
areas, streets and underpasses, as well as other poor drainage areas
and low-lying spots. Rapid rises on small creeks and streams is
occurring, possibly flooding low-water crossings and farmland. Do
not attempt to travel across flooded roads.

NWSheadline: THE FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EST FOR EAST CENTRAL GREENVILLE COUNTY
